questions.question: Can Azure Blob Storage be configured to use lifecycle management policies to automatically move data to the Archive tier?
Is Azure Files suitable for mounting file shares from on-premises Windows servers?
Does Azure Table Storage support complex relational queries and joins?
Is data stored in Azure Blob Storage encrypted at rest by default?
Is Azure Queue Storage used for long-term archival of large documents?
Explain the main differences between Azure Blob Storage and Azure Disk Storage, including use cases for each.
questions.purpose: Assess understanding of Azure storage types and their best-fit scenarios.
scoring_criteria: Describe what Azure Blob Storage is and its use cases (unstructured data, backups, media files, data lakes).
Describe what Azure Disk Storage is and its use cases (VM disks, high-performance workloads).
Compare scalability, performance, and typical consumers.
Mention supported access methods (object vs block access).
Give an example scenario for each storage type.

questions.question: List at least three redundancy options provided by Azure Storage and briefly describe each.
questions.purpose: Assess knowledge of Azure Storage redundancy models.
scoring_criteria: Identify Locally Redundant Storage (LRS) and explain.
Identify Geo-Redundant Storage (GRS) and explain.
Identify Zone-Redundant Storage (ZRS) and explain.
Mention Read-Access Geo-Redundant Storage (RA-GRS) as a possible point.
Briefly compare geographic coverage/protection.

questions.question: Describe the process for securing access to Azure Storage accounts and give two examples of access control methods.
questions.purpose: Assess understanding of authentication and security best practices for Azure Storage.
scoring_criteria: Mention the use of Shared Access Signatures (SAS) or Azure AD for access control.
Describe network security options (firewall, virtual networks).
Explain storage account keys and their security implications.
Give at least two concrete examples (e.g., using SAS tokens, configuring firewall rules).
Mention monitoring or auditing storage access.

questions.question: Explain the benefits of using Azure Virtual Networks in securing application workloads.

scoring_criteria: Describe Azure Virtual Network isolation.
Mention use of subnets and network security groups.
Explain how traffic can be restricted or segmented.

questions.question: Differentiate between Azure Load Balancer and Azure Application Gateway.
questions.purpose: Test knowledge of Azure networking services and their use cases.
scoring_criteria: Define Azure Load Balancer and its layer (Layer 4).
Define Azure Application Gateway and its layer (Layer 7).
Discuss scenarios for each (e.g., TCP/UDP for Load Balancer, HTTP(S) for App Gateway).
Mention application-level features (WAF, SSL offload) for Application Gateway.
Compare health probing and routing capabilities.

scoring_criteria: Define what an Azure Policy is.
Define what an Azure Initiative is.
Explain how initiatives group multiple policies.

questions.question: Explain how Azure Resource Locks can help prevent accidental deletion or modification of critical resources.

scoring_criteria: Describe what a Resource Lock is and available lock levels.

Give at least one real-world example of lock usage.
Mention how locks interact with role-based access control.
